intro: Cremastus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. Its narrow, lance-shaped leaves are arranged oppositely along the stem. Cremastus angustifolius is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
